stanza.line: Not mine own fears nor the prophetic (a)soul(/a)
Of the wide world dreaming on things to (b)come(/b)
Can yet the lease of my true love (a)control(/a)
Supposed as forfeit to a confined (b)doom(/b)
The mortal moon hath her eclipse (c)endured(/c)
And the sad augurs mock their own (d)presage(/d)
And peace proclaims olives of endless (d)age(/d)
Now with the drops of this most balmy (e)time(/e)
My love looks fresh and death to me (f)subscribes(/f)
Since spite of him I'll live in this poor (e)rhyme(/e)
While he insults o'er dull and speechless (f)tribes(/f)
And thou in this shalt find thy (g)monument(/g)
When tyrants' crests and tombs of brass are (g)spent(/g)
